docs.lead_paragraph: If the Supreme Court overturns the Affordable Care Act, it will first have to suspend its own settled approach to interpreting statutes. From Feb. 5, 2015.

headline.seo: Overturning Obamacare Would Change the Nature of the Supreme Court

docs.snippet: If the Supreme Court overturns the Affordable Care Act, it will first have to suspend its own settled approach to interpreting statutes. From Feb. 5, 2015.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The insurer said hackers were able to breach a database that contained as many as 80 million records of current and former customers, including names, Social Security numbers and income data.

headline.main: Millions of Anthem Customers Targeted in Cyberattack
headline.print_headline: Hackers Breached Data of Millions, Insurer Says

docs.abstract: Anthem announces database containing as many as 80 million records of customers and employees has suffered breach by sophisticated cyberattack, including names, Social Security numbers and income data; insurer says it does not believe medical information was compromised, but breach is likely largest of health care company to date, and one of largest ever of customer information.
docs.snippet: The insurer said hackers were able to breach a database that contained as many as 80 million records of current and former customers, including names, Social Security numbers and income data.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

docs.lead_paragraph: While Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo heralded the overall numbers as a sign of the program’s success, having three out of four enrollees on Medicaid could impose a heavy burden on public finances.

headline.main: Two Million New Yorkers Have Signed Up for Insurance on Health Exchange
headline.print_headline: Two Million Signed Up for Insurance on Exchange

docs.abstract: Cuomo administration reports that about two million New York State residents have signed up for insurance under the Affordable Care Act; figures indicate that three quarters of applicants qualified for Medicaid, proportion that could weigh heavily on state budget.
docs.snippet: While Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo heralded the overall numbers as a sign of the program’s success, having three out of four enrollees on Medicaid could impose a heavy burden on public finances.

docs.lead_paragraph: Under the plan, workers would have to pay federal income tax on the value of employer-provided health benefits that exceed certain thresholds.

headline.main: G.O.P. Lawmakers Propose Alternative to Obamacare
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Lawmakers Propose Alternative to Obamacare

docs.abstract: Republican Sens Richard M Burr, Orrin G Hatch and Rep Fred Upton propose alternative to health care reform law that would stop expansion of Medicaid and cut back subsidies for middle-income people to purchase private insurance
docs.snippet: Under the plan, workers would have to pay federal income tax on the value of employer-provided health benefits that exceed certain thresholds.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Hassan Rouhani, in a speech aimed at domestic critics, denounced the United States and Israel for what he called false and hypocritical warnings about Iran’s atomic ambitions.

headline.main: Iran’s President Accuses West of Distorting Atomic Plans
headline.print_headline: Iran President Accuses West of Distorting Atomic Plans

docs.abstract: Iranian Pres Hassan Rouhani accuses United States, Israel and other nuclear-armed countries of hypocrisy, emphasizing that his country wants to use nuclear power for peaceful purposes; comments, delivered in strongly-worded speech aimed at domestic audience, comes as retort to Iranian hard-liners who have accused Rouhani of weakness in international relations.
docs.snippet: President Hassan Rouhani, in a speech aimed at domestic critics, denounced the United States and Israel for what he called false and hypocritical warnings about Iran’s atomic ambitions.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Bill Haslam’s proposal to extend health coverage to 280,000 low-income Tennesseans was defeated Wednesday, 7 to 4, by the Senate Health Committee.

headline.main: Tennessee: Health Care Extension for Poor Is Rejected in Senate
headline.print_headline: Tennessee: Health Care Extension for Poor Is Rejected in Senate

docs.abstract: Senate Health Committee defeats Tennessee Gov Bill Haslam’s proposal to extend health coverage to 280,000 low-income state residents.
docs.snippet: Gov. Bill Haslam’s proposal to extend health coverage to 280,000 low-income Tennesseans was defeated Wednesday, 7 to 4, by the Senate Health Committee.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hackers broke into a health insurance database storing information for about 80 million people in an attack bound to stoke fears many Americans have about the privacy of their most sensitive information.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Bill Haslam's proposal to extend health coverage to 280,000 low-income Tennesseans has failed during a special legislative session.

headline.print_headline: Haslam's Insure Tennessee Health Plan Fails in Legislature

docs.lead_paragraph: Michigan will recognize more than 300 same-sex marriages that were quickly performed in the hours before an appeals court blocked a ruling legalizing the unions, Gov. Rick Snyder announced Wednesday.

headline.main: Gov. Snyder: Michigan Will Recognize About 300 Gay Marriages
headline.print_headline: Gov. Snyder: Michigan Will Recognize About 300 Gay Marriages

docs.snippet: Michigan will recognize more than 300 same-sex marriages that were quickly performed in the hours before an appeals court blocked a ruling legalizing the unions, Gov. Rick Snyder announced Wednesday.
